question: A second-year MBBS student is given a slide of an endocrine gland that contains round and oval structures lined by cuboidal epithelium. Which of the following is most likely the endocrine gland?

What type of epithelial cells will be seen in a hyperactive thyroid?
Which of the following are supporting cells and specialized terminal axonal endings in the posterior lobe of hypophysis?
Regarding the squamous epithelium of the thyroid, which of the following statements is false?

answers.option: It shows in a hypoactive thyroid
It shows in a hyperactive thyroid
It transitions to columnar in hyperactive thyroid
It can be stratified squamous epithelium
It is accompanied by zero to low colloid

question: Which of the following cell types are not a part of the anterior pituitary?
Which of the following glands has follicles with colloid?
What are the glial cells of the posterior pituitary also known as?

Gigantism is a disorder that results from the excessive production of growth hormone leading to a very tall height and large viscera. This condition is due to the hypersecretion from which of the following cells?
Prolactinoma is a tumor of what type of cells?
The thyroid gland is lined by which type of epithelium?
What are the hormone-secreting cells of the adrenal medulla known as?
In gigantism, which of the following cell types is overactive?

A pathologist is observing a specimen from the parathyroid gland. He notices that the glandular cells are small with rounded central nuclei and pale eosinophilic or clear cytoplasm. These cells are arranged in clusters and form 80% of the total volume in normal adults. Which is the most likely cell type that the pathologist observed?
A student examines a histology slide having colloid surrounded by cells. Which following places are the cells extracted from?
In thyroid follicles along with the follicular cells, parafollicular cells are found either individually or in clusters. Which of the following hormone is produced by these parafollicular cells?
Which of the following is correct regarding chromophil cells?

answers.option: Cells that take stain due to mitochondira
Cells that take stain due to granules
Cells that have more than two nucleus

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the histology of the pituitary gland?

answers.option: Pars intermedia is well developed in humans
Thyrotropes are the most abundant cells
Pars distalis makes up 75 % of the gland
Corticotropes are polygonal cells with centrally placed nuclei

question: What zone(s) of the adrenal gland secrete cortisol?
What do the delta cells of islets of Langerhans secrete?

A 45-year-old woman was diagnosed with central diabetes insipidus. On enquiring, the physician informed the lady that the cause of the disease was deficiency of vasopressin from the pituitary gland. Which lobe of the pituitary gland releases this hormone?
Which of the following is correct about chromophobe cells?
Somatotrophs release which of the following hormone?
Which one of the following is not a feature of centroacinar cells?

answers.option: They lack secretory granules and basophilic striations
They are continuous with the epithelium lining the intercalated ducts
They lie inside the serous acini

question: When islets of Langerhans are observed under a compound microscope, cells in the center seem to have a higher percentage than the peripheral ones. Which cell type is present in the center?
Oxyphil and principal cells are found in the parathyroid gland. Which of the following is a feature of oxyphil cells?

answers.option: They are arranged in small clusters
They are smaller than principal cells
They give rise to principal cells

question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the pituitary gland?

answers.option: Pars tuberalis is downward extension of pars distalis
Pars intermedia is a remnant of lumen of Rathke's pouch
Adenohypophysis develops from ectodermal roof of stomodeum
Functionally adenohypophysis is different from neurohypophysis
Adenohypophysis is the largest part of the gland

question: Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding the pancreas?

answers.option: Its intercalated ducts open into striated ducts
The exocrine portion is composed of compound acinar glands
Under electron microscope, the golgi apparatus is supra nuclear in position

question: Which is incorrect about the salivary glands?

answers.option: Striated ducts contribute to hypotonicity of saliva
Submandibular gland is predominantly a serous gland
Myoepithelial cells are absent in submandibular gland
IgA present in saliva is formed by plasma cells, present in lobular connective tissue
Serous demilunes are also present in sublingual gland

question: What do the alpha cells in islets of Langerhans secrete?

A microscopic slide labeled as pancreas revealed the presence of ducts and islets of Langerhans. A duct lined by stratified columnar was also seen. Which type of pancreatic duct is lined by this epithelium?
Which of the following cells are not present in the parenchyma of the parathyroid gland?

A slide having three distinct zones, is shown to a student. Each zone has a different arrangement of cells but cells of all three zones show an abundance of the smooth endoplasmic reticulum. The slide is from which of the following tissue?

During the histological examination, a slide is prepared from a tissue that exhibits multiple spherical follicles. These follicles appear to be lined by tall columnar cells and their cavity is filled with glycoproteins. The slide is taken from which tissue?

answers.option: Inactive stage of the thyroid gland
Active stage of the thyroid gland

question: Chromaffin cells are present in which of the following?

During a histological examination, a student observes a slide showing a group of secretory cells with fenestrated capillaries. On further examination, cells appear to be of four different types. The slide is taken from which of the following?

What is true regarding blood supply to the adrenal gland?

answers.option: Zona fasciculata has dual blood supply
The blood first passes through the kidneys
Blood flows from the medulla to the cortex
Adrenal medulla has both arterial and venous blood supply
Blood is supplied by sinusoids only

question: What differentiates the pancreas from the parotid gland?

answers.option: Presence of striated ducts in the pancreas
Presence of centroacinar cells and absence of striated ducts in the pancreas
Compound glands are present in the pancreas

Secretory cells arranged in a circle around a central duct in the pancreas

question: Which of the following is an endocrine gland with cells abundant with secretory granules and colloids in the luminal area?

answers.option: Synthesis of hormones occurs in follicular cells
Only gland that causes storage of hormones outside

question: Which of the following is incorrect about oxyphil cells?

answers.option: They play a major role in calcium homeostasis
They are arranged in small clusters
They are bigger in size than principal cells

question: Centroacinar cells are present in which of the following?

answers.option: Secretes PTH in response to decreased calcium

question: A student observes a slide of tissue in which oval masses of cells and fenestrated capillaries can be observed. Four types of secretory cells can be recognized in this tissue. Which structure is present on this slide?

answers.option: Acidophilic cytoplasm with abnormal shaped mitochondria
They are larger than principal cells

question: What statement is incorrect regarding the pineal gland?

answers.option: Pineal cells are known as chuff cells
Substances released under the influence of hypothalamus

question: The pancreas is referred to as a compound tubuloacinar gland. Which of the following best describes the word "compound"?
Which of the following is inappropriate regarding the pancreas?

answers.option: The endocrine part of the pancreas is similar to the parotid gland
It contain both endocrine and exocrine parts
Rough endoplasmic reticulum is abundant in serous cells
The exocrine part of the pancreas is similar to the parotid gland

question: Where are fenestrated capillaries present in parathyroid?

answers.option: Separated from the thyroid by a thin capsule
Stroma has reticular and collagen fibers

question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding parathyroid hormone?

The connective tissue between the follicles is scanty
The gland is covered by a capsule made of loose connective tissue

question: Which of the following cells are polygonal and basophilic, with an eccentrically placed round nucleus and present in the pars distalis?

answers.option: Septae dividing the gland into lobules

question: Pheochromocytoma is a medical condition in which the patient experiences tachycardia (increased heart rate), hypertension, excessive sweating, and headaches. It involves which following part of the adrenal gland?

The histologist hinted that the light-stained clusters of cells are the ones producing hormones that underlie the endocrine functions of the pancreas. What is the lightly stained section?

On examining histological slides, the students get confused between the alpha cells and beta cells, forgetting their location in the pancreas. They were informed that the location of alpha cells is in which of the following?

answers.option: Only in the center of islets
Equally in both regions of islets
Only in the periphery of islets

question: Blood mineralocorticoid levels, specifically aldosterone, of a 45-year-old male were found to be on the lower side. The zone of the adrenal gland that is responsible for the synthesis of these hormones is which of the following?

answers.option: They give rise to principal cells
They are larger than principal cells

question: Which of the following is not related to the histology of parathyroid glands?

answers.option: Stroma has reticular and collagen fibers
Separated from the thyroid by a thin capsule

question: A histology slide showed a section of tissue containing chromaffin cells with abundant fairly electron-dense and moderately electron-dense granules. The tissue corresponds to what section of the adrenal gland?

Which of the following structures is being observed?
